trans-unit.source: Enables the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior"></xref> for an endpoint through configuration.

The WebScriptEnablingElement is a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.BehaviorExtensionElement> subtype that can be used to include the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior> on an endpoint through configuration.
There are no configurable properties on this element.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior>, in turn, allows an endpoint to be accessed by ASP.NET AJAX Web pages when it is configured with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding>.

[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] how to enable a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] service to respond to ASP.NET AJAX clients, see [Creating WCF Services for ASP.NET AJAX](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WebScriptEnablingElement"></xref> class.
Gets the type of the behavior enabled by this configuration element.
The <xref:System.Type> for the behavior enabled with the configuration element: <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior"></xref>.
